meanings.sent1: After cleaning the water, we recirculate it in the pool.
meanings.sent2: The fan helps to recirculate the air in the room.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the button to recirculate the same song on the playlist.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to recirculate in the small room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rumor began to recirculate around the school, growing more exaggerated each time.

meanings.sent1: The pump recirculates the coolant to keep the engine from overheating.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recirculate the flyers to reach more people.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to recirculate the test papers after they got mixed up.
meanings.sent4: His speech managed to recirculate hope among the discouraged crowd.
meanings.sent5: The chef would recirculate the soup to blend the flavors perfectly.
